  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

item.title: Report X-2023081893
item.description:
Report X-2023081893

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: HAP specialist was doing a dock walk in the unload to check for damages and repacks when he spotted a damaged hazmat sitting on the floor. it is not known exactly when it was set aside, but definitely the same day. He called out to the HESS specialist for a lined tote and placed it in the tote, allowing HESS specialist to bring it back to the damage area and move it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: two bottles leaked very small amounts due to loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package was called out. QA responded and placed it in a lined tote, performing immediate in-house cleanup. DescribePack: puncture on bottom of jerrican caused product to leak DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023081875
item.description:
Report X-2023081875

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: someone placed the package onto its side, ignoring the directional arrows. sometime later someone called out the damaged hazmat at the loading dock door. QA admin responded, only to find that it was improperly oriented, which is why it leaked. he performed in-house cleanup and placed it in a lined tote, then brought it back to the damage area and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to the package being placed on its side, instead of obeying the directional arrows. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediate in-house cleanup. placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023081623
item.description:
Report X-2023081623

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: hazmat was discovered this morning on the inbound as needing a relabel because the original label was destroyed. someone set it aside and placed a 33 (address search) on the package. this evening the HAP specialist noticed that the package was not in UNPOP packaging and had been repacked by someone at Fedex Ground. He brought it over to the damage area for HESS specialist to inspect later. Around 7:15pm, HESS specialist had the time to inspect and found that the bottles inside had been placed inside a blue hazmat bag and ziptied shut. HESS specialist noticed liquid inside with the bottles and placed it in a lined tote, moving it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: three bottles leaked due to loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats
